page.title: 10A Talk given by Resident "A"
page.content: One of our senior citizens who has lived in the area all his life came to our school to talk to us about changing times. It was interesting to hear about how life has changed since he was a boy. He left school when he was 14 and worked on a farm as did many of his friends. When a teacher came into the classroom, all the children had to stand. He stayed in the same school from 5 to 14 as there wasn't a secondary school. There was very little farm machinery then so all the fields were ploughed using horses. He had to use a pump to fetch water and he bathed in a tin tub once a week. He was very interested in music and joined the local Brass Band in 1927. There weren't many cars on the roads when he was a boy but a local man used to hire out a bicycle for 6d a week.
